modules.description: Handles unit values in graph rendering by providing a function that maps any value to a tuple with a unit and an optional second value. Works with generic types `'a` and `'b`, primarily used in SVG graph node or edge processing. Useful for simplifying transformations where a unit value needs to be paired with an optional payload.

This module generates HTML visualizations of dependency graphs, converting associative graph structures into HTML documents. It provides functions to merge CSS stylesheets, render graphs with optional custom styling and sharing statistics, and pretty-print HTML documents. Use cases include generating browsable dependency visualizations for package managers or interactive graph displays with embedded styling.

This module converts dependency graphs into DOT format for visualization. It provides functions to render `Opam_graph` structures as `Odot.graph` instances, using string identifiers to represent nodes. Use it to generate graphical representations of package dependencies or associations in OPAM.

This module renders graph structures into SVG visuals, generating styled nodes, edges, and hitboxes with text labels positioned via geometric layouts like spiral and grid. It processes dependency graphs and positional data to produce interactive diagrams, enabling use cases such as visualizing package dependencies and analyzing graph relationships through customizable CSS-driven rendering.

Computes dependency relationships from a switch export, returning an associated graph structure. It processes package metadata to map dependencies, optionally including transitive ones. Useful for visualizing or analyzing package dependencies in a switch.

This module provides graph rendering capabilities across multiple output formats. It includes submodules for converting dependency graphs into DOT, SVG, and HTML representations, each tailored for specific visualization needs such as generating interactive diagrams, styled visual outputs, or browsable dependency views. Use cases include visualizing package dependencies in OPAM, creating interactive graph displays, and generating structured visual reports with embedded styling.

This module enables analysis and visualization of package dependencies through graph structures derived from OPAM switch exports. It operates on directed acyclic graphs representing package relationships, supporting queries for direct/transitive dependencies and connected components, while generating structured outputs like DOT, SVG, or interactive HTML diagrams. Typical applications include dependency resolution debugging, package set analysis, and creating navigable visualizations of complex build environments.
